title: So wait, do people on Gameplay and Balance actually think supports are in a bad spot?
body: What in the actual fuck lol

That post about changing ambient gold was probably mine. I don't think supports are in a bad spot, but it is still worth discussing how the role could be improved.

* Gold flow. Is the amount of gold supports get in a game fair?
* Experience. Is it fair that supports are generally underleveled?
* Mage supports. What place in the game do Karma, Zyra, Morgana, etc. have?
* Utility scaling. Is it doing what it should do, and why doesn't Bard have utility scaling?
* Active items. Is the sheer number of active items desirable for the support role?

Discussing the future of supports belongs on Gameplay & Balance and I don't understand why OP has a problem with that.

The support role as a whole seems fine to me in that it has champions that are designed to go with it and they can impact a game from that position.  However, the big reason that there are some champions that are more-or-less dedicated to supporting is that they can be effective without having much in the way of gold or experience.  So the judgement on whether the support role is in a good spot is dependent on what your prerequisites for being a good spot are.

Basically if you think supports need to be able to do their job then yes they are fine; if you think they should get similar amounts of gold and experience to the other roles then they aren't.

> However, the big reason that there are some champions that are more-or-less dedicated to supporting is that they can be effective without having much in the way of gold or experience.

The reason some champions are forced to support is because Riot gutted supports' sclaings in the pre-season 4 "rework."  Hence why now it's become almost mandatory that if a support wishes to scale past laning, they have to look towards artificial scalings like Lich Bane or Echo which do misleading amounts of damage that players fool themselves into believing is part of that champion's damage.

You are looking at only damage scaling there, and a lot of supports are not focused on damage.  No matter how starved a Blitzcrank is, if they grab the enemy ADC they won a teamfight.  No matter how little gold an Alistar has he can still peel like a monster.  Lulu can still get some solid cc and peels down without a boat load of AP.

Yes, they mostly have lower ratios, but that usually goes along with higher bases or utility.

Except, how often do you see a Blitz going into a solo-lane?  It's been a long time since those few weeks where Alistar was pick/ban.  Lulu is a different story entirely, especially considering she was probably the only support that could be considered "buffed" by the support "rework."

True, you don't see Alistar or Blitz solo lane much (I still see it sometimes).  You also don't see Zed support much though.  Support is a role like the others, some champs fit it well and aren't very good elsewhere.
